featureDescription: The GlowOnHover component applies a soft glowing effect to elements within an SVG when hovered. Only elements with the class 'glow' will respond.

params.description: (type: React.ReactElement), Required â€” the SVG element or group to apply glow behavior to
(type: number), Width of the container SVG (default: 300)
(type: number), Height of the container SVG (default: 300)
(type: number), Scale multiplier applied on hover (default: 1.2)
(type: string), Glow color applied as drop-shadow (default: '#D9D9D9')

svg-requirement.explanation: Only SVG elements with the class name 'glow' will respond to hover with the glowing effect.

classes.name: glow
classes.description: Marks the SVG elements that will glow and scale when hovered.

svg-requirement.example:
<svg width="100" height="100" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
  <circle class="glow" cx="50" cy="50" r="30" fill="gold" />
</svg>

examples.title: Glow effect on specific element inside SVG
